candidates.name: Sally Macauley
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Kaikohe for 49 years and have a background in commerce, finance and consumer experience. I have worked with the community and led major projects with successful outcomes. I understand Governance which meets the future needs of the people enabling consultation through democratic and local making decision.
candidates.why_stand: I believe I have the experience and skill to continue what we all aspire to achieve in the western ward. I have stood up and represented the community with successful outcomes. It is my policy to consult and listen to the people.

candidates.name: Lily Rawson
candidates.why_elect: I bring a fresh approach to local Government, I am a people person, (Relationship builder) I will represent my communities, advocating on issues and matters that pertain to them. (Integrity) I work creatively with people who know their job (Trusting). I am not familiar with council that is Good.
candidates.why_stand: I live in Kaikohe, Work in Kaikohe, Invest in Kaikohe and I whiri to Kaikohe and Hokianga. I love the heart of the people, the whenua, the awa, it is unique to you and I. Kaitiaki of the whenua and awa, we sustain the land the land will sustain us.

candidates.name: Marara Rogers
candidates.why_elect: I am securely rooted in both cultures and have long experience in the governance role as trustee to various organisations. I am able to gain cooperation from other council members to arrive at consensus.
candidates.why_stand: I want to see change in the way our local government operates. I have achieved success in community-led projects for the last 17 years. My experience and ability can assist the council to be more responsive to community needs.

candidates.name: Moko Tepania
candidates.why_elect: As an educator, I understand the demands and challenges of working together to achieve positive outcomes for our youth and wider whānau. My range of experiences through education, business and community organisations, provide a strong foundation for working collaboratively and knowledge sharing to enhance and preserve our beautiful communities.
candidates.why_stand: I want to work towards council's goal of 'He whenua rangatira—a district of sustainable prosperity and wellbeing and I want our council to represent the diversity of our district. I am passionate about preserving our environment for future generations, whilst building the infrastructure we need.

candidates.name: John Vujcich
candidates.why_elect: I'm a strategic and critical thinker, have governance and business experience, and have been actively involved in business, training and charities. I'm Hokianga-born and understand our culture and challenges. I bring to council experience, a strong voice, time, a heart, and commitment to sustainable and prosperous communities for all.
candidates.why_stand: I want to see better governance, affordable infrastructure, fit for purpose services, innovative solutions and well-performing teams. I want to see a "can do" council serving our people in partnership with all our people, communities and contractors to deliver better quality services that are fair and equitable for all.

candidates.name: Rhonda Zielinski
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Kaikohe for 40 years. Completed my schooling and nursing training in Tai Tokerau. I live local, shop local, support local and love local. I love Northland, our beaches, playing sport and our wide open spaces. I do not want to see Northland overpopulated and sold off.
candidates.why_stand: I was nominated and supported by whānau and friends who believe in me. Community support and feedback from people I trust and respect made me decide to stand up and give this a go. Power to the people, as long as people vote I will accept whatever the outcome is.

candidates.name: Rawhiti Erstich Coles
candidates.why_stand: I believe we can do better. I've lived my life fighting for what should be a basic right. I believe we shouldn't have to struggle for opportunity and social mobility.
